snippet: The Hudson Project, held at the farm that was supposed to host Woodstock, ended its three-day run with a torrential rainstorm that stranded hundreds in their cars, some for many hours.
abstract: Hudson Project music and arts festival in Saugerties, NY, ends in mud and tears after tumultuous downpour cuts concert short and strands hundreds of people in their cars, parked in two grassy fields, some for many hours.
lead_paragraph: The Hudson Project, held at the farm that was supposed to host Woodstock, ended its three-day run with a torrential rainstorm that stranded hundreds in their cars, some for many hours.

headline.main: Peace, Music and the All-Too-Familiar Mud
headline.print_headline: Peace, Music and the All-Too-Familiar Mud
